alert.note: Alert for Essex; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 10:02AM EDT until April 12 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Essex and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River At Little Falls. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The lower end of East-Holsman Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 6.0 feet, Portions of Hoffman Grove in Wayne sustain some nuisance flooding. At 6.5 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Two Bridges in Wayne are flooded. The lower end of Bergen Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in Lincoln Park, Wayne and Little Falls. At 8.0 feet, Flooding occurs in the "Old" Wayne area of Wayne. The recycling center and Wagaraw Road ball field complex in Hawthorne begins to experience flooding. At 8.5 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in Fairfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Saturday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 12/13/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Passaic River Little Falls 7.0 7.2 Sat 9 am 7.5 7.2 7.5 2am 4/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.
